Culinary Profile & Uses

1. Flavour and Form ‘Pearl-King’ offers the quintessential freshwater prawn profile: an intensely sweet, rich flavor with clean, briny notes and a firm, almost crunchy texture when properly cooked. The meat is opaque white with a distinctive pink blush after cooking. The prawns themselves are robust, with pronounced royal-blue claws in males and a sleek, pearl-opalescent body that shimmers under light.

2. The Versatile Sweet Crustacean This prawn’s robust texture and rich flavor make it suitable for everything from simple grilling to complex sauces.

  • Grilled or BBQ Prawns: The premier preparation - grilled in the shell to develop a smoky aroma, which protects the delicate meat inside and intensifies its natural sweetness.
  • Prawn Scampi or Garlic Butter Sauté: Served shell-on or peeled, its firm texture holds up to quick sautéing in butter, garlic, and white wine without becoming rubbery.
  • Ceviche and Crudo: Its inherent sweetness and firm structure make it excellent for raw applications, “cooking” gently in citrus juice while retaining a pleasant bite.
  • Hearty Curries and Stews: Adds a luxurious, sweet depth to coconut-based curries and bisques, where its shell can be used to enrich the broth.

3. The Harvest & Growth Cycle ‘Pearl-King’ exhibits rapid, synchronized growth under optimal warm water conditions (26-30°C). It is less aggressive than standard strains, allowing for higher stocking densities. Reared in an AquaPod or IMTA Shrimp Ring system, a cohort provides a concentrated, single-harvest yield of 40-60 premium prawns per 50-liter pod, reaching optimal harvest size of 30g in just 10-12 weeks from post-larval stage.
